0.5 million views

Rummaging through my old YouTube channel, I found a video that I had shared more than a couple of years ago.

For preparation of the TEDxDelft in 2011, I met the Dutch creator and creative genius Theo Jansen as an enthusiast to help him out on a weekend to setup and trial out his strandbeests. He builds ‘animals’ out of PVC pipes and makes them move with his very own engineering feat and before that meeting, I had only read one or two articles about him.

When I met him that day, he offered us coffee and a warm stay at the beach near The Hague where he lives. I personally got to talk to him about how he makes these creatures.

He single-handedly creates these strandbeests capable of running autonomously (with a trigger of course). Why you must ask? For fun. Check out the BBC’s documentation of Theo Jansen’s work.

Here’s the video I took of him setting one of his creations to a start:

It’s gotten close to 500,000 views and I’m very happy to share it here so more of you can take a look at what he builds.

Here’s the link to his TED talk which, to this day, remains one of the best TED talks in the history of TED.

Here’s 2011 me with Theo!
